name: Calculus I
description: This course provides an introduction to differential calculus. Students will learn about limits, derivatives, and their applications.

name: Calculus II
description: This course provides an introduction to integral calculus. Students will learn about integrals, series, and their applications.

name: Physics I
description: This course provides an introduction to classical mechanics. Students will learn about kinematics, dynamics, and conservation laws.

name: Physics II
description: This course provides an introduction to electromagnetism and thermodynamics. Students will learn about electric and magnetic fields, circuits, and heat.

name: Engineering Mechanics
description: This course provides an introduction to statics and dynamics. Students will learn about forces, moments, equilibrium, and motion.

name: Introduction to Transportation Engineering
description: This course provides an introduction to the field of transportation engineering. Students will learn about the history of transportation, modes of transportation, and transportation systems.

name: Data Analysis and Modeling in Transportation Engineering
description: This course provides an introduction to data analysis and modeling in transportation engineering. Students will learn about statistical methods, simulation techniques, and optimization tools.

name: Transportation Planning
description: This course provides an introduction to transportation planning. Students will learn about the principles of transportation planning, travel demand modeling, traffic flow theory, and transportation network design.
prerequisites: Data Analysis and Modeling in Transportation Engineering

name: Transportation Infrastructure Design
description: This course provides an introduction to transportation infrastructure design. Students will learn about geometric design, pavement design, and traffic control devices.
prerequisites: Data Analysis and Modeling in Transportation Engineering

name: Public Transportation Systems
description: This course provides an introduction to public transportation systems. Students will learn about transit planning, operations, and management.

name: Traffic Engineering
description: This course provides an introduction to traffic engineering. Students will learn about traffic flow characteristics, capacity analysis, and traffic signal design.

name: Transportation Policy and Economics
description: This course provides an introduction to transportation policy and economics. Students will learn about transportation policy analysis, project evaluation, and funding mechanisms.

name: Advanced Topics in Transportation Engineering
description: This course provides an overview of advanced topics in transportation engineering. Students will learn about emerging technologies, sustainability, and transportation safety.
